   18: %% %CopyrightEnd%
   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(bs_match_tail_r25_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -author('bjorn@erix.ericsson.se').
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   25: 	 aligned/1,unaligned/1,zero_tail/1,huge_tail/1]).
   26: 
   27: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   28: 
   29: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   30: 
   31: all() -> 
   32:     [aligned, unaligned, zero_tail, huge_tail].
   33: 
   34: 
   35: %% Test aligned tails.
   36: aligned(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   37:     Tail1 = mkbin([]),
   38:     {258,Tail1} = al_get_tail_used(mkbin([1,2])),
   39:     Tail2 = mkbin(lists:seq(1, 127)),
   40:     {35091,Tail2} = al_get_tail_used(mkbin([137,19|Tail2])),
   41: 
   42:     64896 = al_get_tail_unused(mkbin([253,128])),
   43:     64895 = al_get_tail_unused(mkbin([253,127|lists:seq(42, 255)])),
   44: 
   45:     Tail3 = mkbin(lists:seq(0, 19)),
   46:     {0,Tail1} = get_dyn_tail_used(Tail1, 0),
   47:     {0,Tail3} = get_dyn_tail_used(mkbin([Tail3]), 0),
   48:     {73,Tail3} = get_dyn_tail_used(mkbin([73|Tail3]), 8),
   49: 
   50:     0 = get_dyn_tail_unused(mkbin([]), 0),
   51:     233 = get_dyn_tail_unused(mkbin([233]), 8),
   52:     23 = get_dyn_tail_unused(mkbin([23,22,2]), 8),
   53:     ok.
   54: 
   55: al_get_tail_used(<<A:16,T/binary>>) -> {A,T}.
   56: al_get_tail_unused(<<A:16,_/binary>>) -> A.
   57: 
   58: %% Test that an non-aligned tail cannot be matched out.
   59: unaligned(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   60:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch get_tail_used(mkbin([42]))),
   61:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,_},_}} = (catch get_dyn_tail_used(mkbin([137]), 3)),
   62:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch get_tail_unused(mkbin([42,33]))),
   63:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,_},_}} = (catch get_dyn_tail_unused(mkbin([44]), 7)),
   64:     ok.
   65: 
   66: get_tail_used(<<A:1,T/binary>>) -> {A,T}.
   67: 
   68: get_tail_unused(<<A:15,_/binary>>) -> A.
   69: 
   70: get_dyn_tail_used(Bin, Sz) ->
   71:     <<A:Sz,T/binary>> = Bin,
   72:     {A,T}.
   73: 
   74: get_dyn_tail_unused(Bin, Sz) ->
   75:     <<A:Sz,_/binary>> = Bin,
   76:     A.
   77: 
   78: %% Test that zero tails are tested correctly.
   79: zero_tail(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   80:     7 = (catch test_zero_tail(mkbin([7]))),
   81:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch test_zero_tail(mkbin([1,2]))),
   82:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch test_zero_tail2(mkbin([1,2,3]))),
   83:     ok.
   84: 
   85: test_zero_tail(<<A:8>>) -> A.
   86: 
   87: test_zero_tail2(<<_A:4,_B:4>>) -> ok.
   88: 
   89: huge_tail(_Config) ->
   90:     42 = huge_tail_1(id(<<42,0:16#1001>>)),
   91:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = catch huge_tail_1(id(<<0:8,0:10>>)),
   92: 
   93:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = catch huge_tail_2(id(<<0:8,0:100>>)),
   94: 
   95:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = catch huge_tail_3(id(<<0:8,0:200>>)),
   96: 
   97:     %% The following code is commented out by default because it
   98:     %% constructs a 2Gb binary.
   99: 
  100:     %% try huge_tail_2(id(<<100, 0:16#8000_0000>>)) of
  101:     %%     100 ->
  102:     %%         ok
  103:     %% catch
  104:     %%     error:function_clause ->
  105:     %%         ct:fail(not_supposed_to_fail)
  106:     %% end,
  107: 
  108:     ok.
  109: 
  110: %% On AArch64, the immediate for the `cmp` instruction is 12 bits (unsigned).
  111: huge_tail_1(<<B:8,_:16#1001>>) -> B.
  112: 
  113: %% On x86_64, the immediate for the `cmp` instruction is 32 bits (signed).
  114: huge_tail_2(<<B:8, _:16#8000_0000>>) -> B.
  115: 
  116: %% Matching will fail on all platforms.
  117: huge_tail_3(<<B:8, _:16#1_0000_0000_0000_0000>>) -> B.
  118: 
  119: %%%
  120: %%% Common utilities.
  121: %%%
  122: mkbin(L) when is_list(L) -> list_to_binary(id(L)).
  123: 
  124: id(I) -> I.
